points: BLS projects a 17.9% increase in software developer jobs from 2023 to 2033 due to AI. [https://www.bls.gov/opub/ted/2025/ai-impacts-in-bls-employment-projections.htm]
In May 2023, AI was responsible for 3,900 job losses in the U.S., ranking as the seventh-largest job eliminator. [https://www.nu.edu/blog/ai-job-statistics/]

Goldman Sachs estimates AI could affect 25% of the global labor market, potentially impacting 300 million jobs. [https://www.forbes.com/sites/jackkelly/2025/04/25/the-jobs-that-will-fall-first-as-ai-takes-over-the-workplace/]
AI systems pose ethical challenges, including bias amplification and privacy concerns. [https://www.shs-conferences.org/articles/shsconf/pdf/2023/28/shsconf_ichess2023_04024.pdf]

UNESCO's 'Recommendation on the Ethics of Artificial Intelligence' was the first global AI ethics standard, released in November 2021. [https://www.unesco.org/en/artificial-intelligence/recommendation-ethics]

content.headline: AI's Dual Impact on Jobs
content.body: AI is reshaping the job market. BLS forecasts a 17.9% rise in software developer roles by 2033, yet AI also cut 3,900 jobs in May '23. Ethical challenges remain. #AI #JobMarket
